attributes.action: If the UK does not get a trade deal with the EU, Boris Johnson should resign.
attributes.additional_details:
Boris Johnson has steered the UK in front of the gaping chasm that is a No Deal Brexit at the absolute worst possible time, right in the middle of an ever expanding health crisis.

A No Deal - even under the best of circumstances - would hurt the UK. A No Deal at this point in time would be a disaster beyond measure.

A PM is supposed to protect his citizens. By allowing a no deal, Johnson is utterly failing in his duties.

No Deal = No Boris
attributes.background: Johnson should tie his fate to that the Trade Agreement outcome and resign if a deal with the European Union is not achieved before the end of 2020.

rejection.details: We can't accept petitions which call for someone to be given a job, or to lose one they currently have. Petitions cannot override someone's right to due process.
